channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Perfect complexes and completion
item.description: arXiv:2411.14761v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $\hat{R}$ be the $I$-adic completion of a commutative ring $R$ with respect to a finitely generated ideal $I$. We give a necessary and sufficient criterion for the category of perfect complexes over $\hat{R}$ to be equivalent to the subcategory of dualizable objects in the derived category of $I$-complete complexes of $R$-modules. Our criterion is always satisfied when $R$ is noetherian. When specialized to $R$ local and noetherian and to $I$ the maximal ideal, our theorem recovers a recent result of Benson, Iyengar, Krause and Pevtsova.
item.dc:creator: Paul Balmer, Beren Sanders

item.title: Every finitely generated abelian group is the class group of a generalized cluster algebra
item.description: arXiv:2411.14963v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We determine the class group of those generalized cluster algebras that are Krull domains. In particular, this provides a criterion for determining whether or not a generalized cluster algebra is a UFD. In fact, any finitely generated abelian group can be realized as the class group of a generalized cluster algebra. Additionally, we show that generalized cluster algebras are FF-domains and that their cluster variables are strong atoms. Finally, we examine the factorization and ring-theoretic properties of Laurent phenomenon algebras.
item.dc:creator: Mara Pompili

item.title: A classification of Mengerian $4$-uniform hypergraphs derived from graphs
item.description: arXiv:2311.11799v2 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we give a classification of all Mengerian $4$-uniform hypergraphs derived from graphs.
item.dc:creator: Winfried Hochst\"attler, Mehrdad Nasernejad

item.title: Homological properties of the relative Frobenius morphism
item.description: arXiv:2401.01880v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This work concerns maps of commutative noetherian local rings containing a field of positive characteristic. Given such a map $\varphi$ of finite flat dimension, the results relate homological properties of the relative Frobenius of $\varphi$ to those of the fibers of $\varphi$. The focus is on the complete intersection property and the Gorenstein property.
item.dc:creator: Peter M. McDonald

item.title: Matrix invertible extensions over commutative rings. Part II: determinant liftability
item.description: arXiv:2404.17656v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A unimodular $2\times 2$ matrix $A$ with entries in a commutative ring $R$ is called weakly determinant liftable if there exists a matrix $B$ congruent to $A$ modulo $R\det(A)$ and $\det(B)=0$; if we can choose $B$ to be unimodular, then $A$ is called determinant liftable. If $A$ is extendable to an invertible $3\times 3$ matrix $A^+$, then $A$ is weakly determinant liftable. If $A$ is simple extendable (i.e., we can choose $A^+$ such that its $(3,3)$ entry is $0$), then $A$ is determinant liftable. We present necessary and/or sufficient criteria for $A$ to be (weakly) determinant liftable and we use them to show that if $R$ is a $\Pi_2$ ring in the sense of Part I (resp.\ is a pre-Schreier domain), then $A$ is simply extendable (resp.\ extendable) iff it is determinant liftable (resp.\ weakly determinant liftable). As an application we show that each $J_{2,1}$ domain (as defined by Lorenzini) is an elementary divisor domain.
item.dc:creator: Grigore C\u{a}lug\u{a}reanu, Horia F. Pop, Adrian Vasiu
